name: donsoze
text:
Miami uses the word "Salad" in his evaluations of the first three competitors.

Just though I'd point that out.

name: cromulent
text: Salad is a constant resident in the back of the American con's mind.

name: untilyouaresonude
text: Holy shit, I never even considered that the salad in "salad tongs" went with the other two...shit.

name: i_love_kate
text: What's with all this salad imagery? Did you just see a salad?

name: fattypneumonia
text: Would somebody stop these people from saying salad ?

name: pastrami
text: Salad.

name: mockereo
text: literally. They'd eat it and they wouldn't say it, because their mouths would be full.

name: terribleman
text: In Denmark a police van is called a salad dish. I've always wondered about that...

name: hellofyellin
text: Never once noticed.  5'd just for that.

name: hollis
text: Prison food probably rarely includes salad.  He may have cravings.

name: firesign
text: Actually, it... um... ...no. I will not make this joke. Never mind. Move on with your lives.

name: waldo913
text: Chubbied for your restraint.

name: epicurus
text: A comment left by epicurus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Howard, Agika, stoned_lightning)

name: hollis
text: Chubby for making fun of the other Achewood geeks when you know you are one :)

name: epicurus
text: Actually despite how that looks, I am not making fun. The above comment of mine is best read as just the part up to the "..."

name: juancarlos
text: Every one of the guys' reactions is solid Gold, from Téodor's "...Oh my God" to Lyle's "Stary Hard Miami" and his non-surprise at the fact he'll end up doing serious time one day.

name: liquidcruelty
text: Not only that, he used three different definitions of the word. Classy.

name: liquidcruelty
text: Also I like that Lyle isn't easily shaken even when a judgment like this is handed down.  He will grow from this experience.

name: dovey
text: I like that Lyle is even in the midst of competition, he is still clutching his bottle of JD's.

name: mugi
text: If I could, I'd give you more chubbies for spelling "judgment" correctly.

name: trout
text: http://www.alphadictionary.com/articles/english_grammar_style/spell_judgment.html

name: deusoma
text: I like how they still don't come right out and blatantly answer their own question at the end, they make you think about it at least a little.

name: envika
text: I KNEW THIS! i just didn't post it in time.

name: gmm
text: I am so sorry, I meant to Chubbie you for your observation, but I hit late by mistake. Have my firstborn?

name: tekende
text: I think you should apologize to Late for hitting it, really.

name: milesdonovan
text: Before this strip I had never even heard the term "salad days." Thanks Achewood, for broadening my horizons again

name: chaesar
text: Try to find the Monty Python skit called "Salad Days" it is pretty absurd but funny.

name: tellumo
text: I say! Lionel! Catch!

name: scraggg
text: Pretty strong meat there from Sam Peckinpah.

name: trollcollins
text: It is from Shakespeare!

name: dirtyantaeus
text: "A man-rape conga line" is priceless.

name: behka
text: agreed

name: spinynorman
text: That is like my least favorite kind of conga line

name: aliiis
text: It is Will Self's favourite kind of conga line, seriously read any Will Self book and about 90% probability he will have managed to reference "a veritable conga line of buggery". And also used the words 'jejune' and 'shibboleth'.

name: mugi
text: I agree wholeheartedly.

name: ghostd
text: I guess it is assumed Pat said he was in prison for killing a barber. I believe no one will ever hate anything more than Pat hates barbers.

name: prine
text: I was amusing myself with the possibility that he'd just chucked out some anti-barber diatribe in the middle of telling Miami about all the people he'd shot.

name: chrissketch
text:
He did it nonchalantly. Perhaps compared the mental capacity of someone he loathes to that of a barber.
Miami: "What ABOUT barbers?"
Pat: *anti-barber diatribe*

name: dirtyantaeus
text:
Pat has a well-documented hate for barbers.

http://m.assetbar.com/achewood/uua9cvRlH

name: falseprophet
text: Onstad didn't even have to depict Pat's actual turn at bat, but when it comes time for the evaluation, it is no hard sell to get us to believe he done fucked up. The in-between is tastefully left to the imagination.

name: cracker
text: Miami does not even mention whether or how much he thinks Pat has been in prison. He just plain does not like Pat.

name: agika
text: After he shut everyone (except Cornelius!) down so hardcore, I kind of want Miami to be a regular character now.  Even if he stays in the box.

name: stuart
text: And Lyle, lest we forget.

name: tekende
text: ESPECIALLY if he stays in the box.

name: vermy
text: Miami in the box sets the imagination soaring. Miami out of the box will just be another cat.

name: wehavemagnums
text: I often find myself saying "AGH! I gamble, I lose."

name: nessotron
text: To be fair, Russian prisons have a much bigger rape problem than the ones here in the good ol' USA.

name: stop
text: I believe this is a fact. Not sure why it's been lamed.

name: dovey
text: Lamed by two members of The American prison population, incensed at nessotron's implying that rape isn't a big , nay a necessary , part of the US prison experience.

name: fineoakstructure
text: Possibly because it was technically a "reply" to wehavemagnums' post, yet it had nothing to do with wehavemagnums' post.  If so, that's really fucking nitpicky, assetbastards.

name: spinynorman
text:
Actually, I think it did have something to do with it. Vlad's "I gamble, I lose," may have meant that he was assuming that rape in American prisons was just as dominant as it is in Russian ones. It may in fact be a "man-rape conga line."

We are discussing a man's comment about a robot's comment about rape in prisons on a webcomic on the internet.

name: carpetbag
text: When I first read this strip, I thought Téodor's reaction was the result of his deducing who was inside the box. Now I don't know what to think.

name: differentdog
text: you should think that he is shocked by hearing something incredibly graphic and disturbing, because that is exactly what is happening

name: eatmorekix
text: well, suppose someone told you that if you ever ended up incarcerated you would most definitely be forced to vigorously tongue-bathe numerous assholes. what would you say?

name: stereo
text: You think up the felonies, I'll commit them.

name: centipede_damascus
text: In the old days, it was understood that sometimes trouble found good men and they would spend some time in the big house. Johnny Cash told me about that.

name: nutmeg
text: A comment left by nutmeg was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by nighttoad, mygoodfriend, Connellingus, waldo913, Zem, usversusthem, echidnaboy)

name: petro
text: I will never be able to eat at a buffet restaurant called "Saladay's" that is near me without thinking of ass-munching.

name: goatmasterflash
text:
A pun is never a good choice for a restaurant name, even when it doesn't involve the word "salad".

It is now one year later. Is Saladay's still in the green?

name: mangtastic
text:
I would assume that their business has, aha, wilted a fair amount.

Puns!

name: senseihollywood
text: Teodor is horrified cause he knows it's true...

name: nighttoad
text: this strip has one of my all-time favorite alt texts. i have no idea what it means, but it made me say the word "thirty-fird" aloud.

name: tekende
text: Probably Onstad received a birthday card from his mortgage holders, or a company trying to get him to purchase a mortgage from him, the same way you get birthday postcards from your dentist (or at least, I do, I don't know about the rest of you).

name: hughnin
text:
"sometimes trouble finds good men; you left your porch light on"
Love That.

name: grandpayum
text: 5 for continuance of pat's barber hate

name: breadcrab
text: Anyone else think that this box is similar to the one in which the children will die? Or is that just me?

name: epicurus
text: Now that you mention it...

name: xiaomimi
text:
Today's Blogs

Philippe: Where is the communism poster?!
Onstad: How My Birthday Went
Nice Pete: Plum season is almost here

name: dovey
text:
Mad chubbies for letting me see this:

Hello Google
Please read my words Google
Computer Computer Google
Who invented you Google
You beautiful thing

name: bixschmix
text:
Yes, also this beauty of a sentence by Philippe, which is amazing and showcases just how phenomenal Onstad is at writing children:

"I didn't know what to do so I yelled for Lyle and he saw what happened and he went outside and I can't say what he did but he said that birds can't burp and only one thing can happen once they start choking but if that is true how come they up-chuck for their babies and he said that is different that is a different system meant only for feeding their babies and he and then and Lyle got his smells on Franky and Franky is in a towel in the laundry room but he is okay but we but he but what if he but his mom and if I and Lyle said we would bury her but I don't want him to and all I can do is cry tonight! Today is so awful!"

name: obvious
text: Happy 31rd, Chis!

name: fakedaisies
text: As someone whose name is constantly misspelled by corporations and well-meaning but distant acquaintances, this alt text made me laugh out loud.

name: greenkoolayd
text: according to 'shawshank redemption' and 'american history x', prison IS a butt-rape conga line.

name: quinlaenar
text: It happened once in American History X, and once on screen, possibly a few more, in Shawshank. Not THAT bad.

name: greenkoolayd
text:
thankfully, they only portray it those few times.

"not THAT bad." as for me and my butthole, once is too many times.

name: vulpes-aurum
text:
:Read ALT Text:

"Happy 31rd birthday Chris Onsteadt! --Sincerely, The Home Mortgage Pro's"

31rd?
